section.title: Overview over the classes
section.para: In the following sections, the classes of the Touch Library are described. Each class description consists of: Requirements, Description and Class Overview. In the Requirements, the name of classes you need to know, in order to understand the described class is given. Description is a short description of what the class does. It is more detailed than just the class description that you find in the class header. The Class Overview provides a class diagram.
section.title: Most important classes for developers
TOUCH_CONSOLE
Requirements
section.para: NONE
section.title: Description
section.para: The console displays results of feature calls or ordinary text. It inherits from EM_TEXTAREA which itself is inheriting from EM_TEXTBOX.

The features append_text and put_string append the new text which is passed as string-argument at the end of the text already existing in the console. The feature prepend_text inserts the new text at the beginning of the already present text. Feature show displays the text in the area specified as console.
The console is created in the TOUCH_3D_SCENE and is disabled, that nobody can write into it.
section.title: Class overview
TOUCH_LINE
Requirements
section.para: TRAFFIC_LINE, TRAFFIC_LINE_REPRESENTATION
section.title: Description
section.para: The class TOUCH_LINE represents a touch line.
The touch line connects the TRAFFIC_LINE with its TRAFFIC_3D_LINE_REPRESENTATION. The calls are forwarded to the corresponding class.
section.title: Class overview
TOUCH_MAP
Requirements
section.para: NONE
section.title: Description
section.para: This class forwards calls to the TRAFFIC_MAP and the TOUCH_3D_MAP_WIDGET.
section.title: Class overview
TOUCH_PARIS_OBJECTS
Requirements
section.para: None
section.title: Description
section.para: This class TOUCH_PARIS_OBJECTS is a collection of all predefined objects used by the examples of touch.
The lines and places are created using once.
The information, if paris is loaded can be retrieved by invoking the feature is_paris_loaded.
section.title: Class overview
TOUCH_SIMPLE_LINE
Requirements
section.para: NONE
section.title: Description
section.para: This class forwards calls to the class TRAFFIC_SIMPLE_LINE and its representation.
The creation feature make_with_line_and_represenation takes a TRAFFIC_SIMPLE_LINE and a TRAFFIC_LINE_REPRESENTATION to set the internal implementation features.
The connection from the line to ist representation is needed for the highlighting of the line.

section.title: TOUCH_3D_APPLICATION
Requirements
section.para: TOUCH_3D_CONSTANTS
section.title: Description
section.para: The TOUCH_3D_APPLICATION sets the first scene of the example. Feature make initializes the screen and sets the scene. All the individual examples are inheriting from this class to set the specific "example_3d_application".
section.title: Class overview
TOUCH_3D_CONSTANTS
Requirements
section.para: NONE
section.title: Description
section.para: Here are all the widgets defined which are used for the main window. The size of the main window is specified as well as properties for the objects which are drawn on the map (For example the line width, the place height, the plane size etc.).

The feature map_to_gl_coords transforms the coordinates specified in the xml file to the coordinates of the plane. The Louvre has for example the xml-coordinates around (530, 640). Transformed to the plane which has coordinates between -25 and 25 in both axix, the Louvre has gl-coordinates of around (4.9, -1.6).
section.title: Class overview
TOUCH_3D_MAP_WIDGET
Requirements
section.para: TRAFFIC_3D_MAP_WIDGET
section.title: Description
section.para: The class TOUCH_3d_MAP_WIDGET adds events and their handlers to the map from TRAFFIC_3d_MAP_WIDGET.
The following event handlers are added: The wheel_down and wheel_up zoom into, respectively out of the map. The mouse_drag rotated the map.
section.title: Class overview
TOUCH_3D_SCENE
Requirements
section.para: TOUCH_3D_CONSTANTS, EXCEPTIONS, EM_COMPONENT_SCENE
section.title: Description
section.para: Here are all the widgets which are used for the main window created. The feature make creates all buttons and subscribes its event handlers. It furthermore combines the buttons and the console to the panel at the right side.

From this class, all the examples have to inherit from in order to define its individual scene. For example, the PREVIEW_3D_SCENE from the preview example inherits from this class to subscribe the click_here_button and to create and invoke the example code of preview.
section.title: Class overview
TOURISM
Requirements
section.para: TOUCH_PARIS_OBJECTS
section.title: Description
section.para: In this class, the TOUCH_MAP "Paris" is loaded. Features which are used in the individual examples (explore and explore_on_button_click) are defined as deferred.
The information, which map has been loaded can be retrieved by invoking the feature is_zurich_loaded or is_paris_loaded.
Access to the touch_3d_map_widget is given through the map_widget and to the touch_console through the feature console.
The feature run sets the map_widget and the console and invokes explore.
